data.name: Convert Def To Lambda
data.description:
# Convert Def To Lambda

```if:python
In this kata, you will be given a string with a [def function](https://www.w3schools.com/python/python_functions.asp) in it. Your task is to convert that def function to a [lambda function](https://www.w3schools.com/python/python_lambda.asp), with the same exact variables, the exact funtion name, and the exact function it does.
```
```if:javascript
In this kata, you will be given a string with a [function](https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_functions.asp) in it. Your task is to convert that function to a [arrow/lambda function](https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_arrow_function.asp), with the same exact variables, the exact funtion name, and the exact function it does.
```
The output should be returned as a string

### Examples

```python
"""
def func(a):
    return a * 1
"""
```
```javascript
`
function func(a) {
    return a * 1;
}
`
```
the above should return:

```python
"func = lambda a: a * 1"
```
```javascript
"const func = a => a * 1;"
```
the tests and outputs will look more like this:

```python
convert_def_to_lambda("def func(a):\n    return a * 1")
# the output should be "func = lambda a: a * 1"
```
```javascript
convertFuncToArrow("function func(a) {\n    return a * 1;\n}");
// the output should be const func = a => a * 1;
```

### Notes

- The output should be formatted with the correct number of spaces as the example give above.
- variable number of spaces, positions/keyword arguments, or zero arguments will not be tested
- double parameters will not be tested

Happy Coding!

_If you liked this, you can also check out the opposite of this kata: [Convert Lambda To Def](https://www.codewars.com/kata/605d25f4f24c030033da9afb)_
